question.text: Which of the following statements regarding decomposition is false?

options.text: Warm and moist environment favours decomposition.
Decomposition rate is slower if detritus is rich in chitin and lignin.
Precipitation of soluble inorganic nutrients into the soil horizon as unavailable salts is called mineralisation.

solution.text:
Leaching: Part of water-soluble substances present in the fragmented and decomposition detritus (e.g., sugars, inorganic nutrients) go down into the soil horizon by percolating water and get precipitated as unavailable salts.

Mineralisation: It is the release of inorganic substances by saprophytic microbes (e.g. CO2, H2O, minerals) from organic matter or humus during the process of decomposition.
